text: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: My job is not to be easy on people. My job is to make them better.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Being responsible sometimes means pissing people off.
author: Colin Powell

text: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
author: Peter F. Drucker

text: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: To do great things is difficult; but to command great things is more difficult.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
author: Aristotle

text: A cowardly leader is the most dangerous of men.
author: Stephen King

text: Leadership is unlocking people’s potential to become better.
author: Bill Bradley

text: Never give an order that can’t be obeyed.
author: Douglas MacArthur

text: He who has great power should use it lightly.
author: Seneca

text: When eagles are silent, parrots begin to chatter.
author: Winston S. Churchill

text: What you do has far greater impact than what you say.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Earn your leadership every day.
author: Michael Jordan

text: As we look ahead into the next century, leaders will be those who empower others.
author: Bill Gates

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right — for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A throne is only a bench covered with velvet.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: Where there is no vision, there is no hope.
author: George Washington Carver

text: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln
